verses.roman:
kṛṣṇa-preme unmatta, vihvala digambara
kṛṣṇa-guṇa-līlā gāya, nāce nirantara

synonyms: kṛṣṇa-preme—in ecstatic love of Kṛṣṇa; unmatta—almost mad; vihvala—overwhelmed; digambara—without any dress; kṛṣṇa—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; guṇa—attributes; līlā—pastimes; gāya—chants; nāce—dances; nirantara—constantly.
translation: Intoxicated by ecstatic love for Lord Kṛṣṇa, he becomes overwhelmed and incessantly dances without clothing and sings about Lord Kṛṣṇa's qualities and pastimes.
